results.description:
This is Daniel Jordano, actor and author of the humbly titled: "The Best Book on Acting: How to Become a Better Actor Instantly Without Killing Yourself with the Method"

If you are an actor, you've probably done your fair share of pointless exercises in classes: "Hold the imaginary teacup. Feel the warmth of the tea. Can you smell it? Can you smell it?" ...or you may have had your fill of "gurus" who may direct scenes, but don't give actors any understanding of how to get where they need to get--on their own!

Well we are launching a NEW workshop on Sept. 24th called “The Life Acting Workshop” where we don't have any gurus. We focus on each member putting up work in an atmosphere of helping one another using a simple and effective system called …LIFE ACTING...with an emphasis on ON CAMERA work.

Life Acting is summed up in the question: “What does your character want from the other actors/characters and how are you going to get it? At the current time, we are limited to 10 committed actors. The experience level is not the key issue here, but the willingness to make a commitment to the work.

Each workshop is only $25. Cash, Check made out to Veritas Arts International, or paypal: veritasartsinc@gmail.com

The initial one will take place from 7pm to 10pm on Thursday, September 24th My goal for this is to develop an encouraging and safe place to work and improve our craft as actors. I am serving as the facilitator. Not a guru. We will learn and be encouraged by ONE ANOTHER!
results.name: The Life Acting Workshop

results.description:
Write, Speak, and Teach is a meetup to create momentum for its members to create and ship great content.

If you are a writer, speaker, or teacher (or an author, podcaster, coach, or trainer) you need to get the word out about your work. Content marketing is the best way to get the word out and build your platform.

Content marketing means creating great content, in multiple formats, and then engaging with others about the content, in ways that creates more content, which builds your brand and visibility. 

In the process of creating content, your best effort and a deadline should be the goal, not perfection. 

Lets come together as a group in fun interactive ways, to learn, to take on the challenge of disciplined content creation, and to create momentum for ourselves and each other. 

This group requests member dues because we meet in NYC at a cool interactive space, which costs decent money.

Our first meetup will be a "Launch Some Work" challenge to get the ball rolling.

"Create and ship... create and ship..."
results.name: Write, Speak & Teach - Platform Builders Meetup

results.description: We are a social group for LGBTQ Single Parents. Whether you are single by choice, divorce, or widowhood, this is a place for us to get together, socialize, share resources, and be proud of who we are. Whether you are a parent through biology, adoption, Donor Egg/Sperm, Surrogacy or Fostering, let's connect! Maybe you have been out since you were 12. Maybe you are just coming out. Either way, you are all included. Maybe you are just thinking of becoming a single LGBT parent, or perhaps you are already in the midst of trying and need encouragement and advice. All are welcome. All gender identities and queer sexual orientations are included. We meet in kid friendly spaces so we don't have to get babysitters. We go to the Gay Center Family Play Day together so we are not the only single parents there. We meet for a picnic in the park, or even sometimes go out for a night on the town. Let's unite! Get to know each other! Share struggles and celebrate our triumphs! We are amazing and we should all know each other!

Learning an art form also makes one more receptive, sensitive and helps in the development of one’s aesthetic nature. This outlook helps a person to work not only for oneself but also for society at large and thus the masses are benefited. To organize workshops, lecture-demonstrations and Meets with prominent artists & Gurus, with an aim to nurture and further develop the participants interest and give the participants a platform to interact with the senior artists and Gurus and learn from them directly. results.description:
Welcome to Go Wild NYC! 

Our meetup group is dedicated to all the outdoor adventure loving people of NYC to experience a kick ass lineup of events in the state parks and private campgrounds surrounding the Hudson Valley and the Catskills. 

From October - April we'll be hosting a regular schedule of day trips, and multi day trips to some of the most beautiful New York State Parks and natural wonders to explore the outdoors and all it has to offer. 

In the winter season we'll be hosting as many trips as possible up to the mountains as well for our NYC Snow Bums to hit the slopes upstate and in Vermont. 


Our Trips Include

Waterfall & Nature Hikes
Swimming Holes
Delaware River Tubing
Camping January - April
Snowboarding
Skiing

Whether you want to just kick back in one of the beautiful state parks with your friends to BBQ and party with the local wildlife, or if your a novice or an experienced skier or boarder looking for a quick staycay and a cool way to meet new people to have a great time then this club is for you. 


The club has it's own 14 passenger van for transporting our members to our events and is outfitted with a custom roof rack to carry any type of gear to our events so bring your boards, coolers, couches, koozies... and whatever else you need!

We have a deeply rooted love for the Catskill's and Hudson Valley area's and have been exploring there for over 20 years. 

It would be our pleasure to be your sherpa. Once the fall and winter season are over we also run a membership club and meetup called NYC Beach Bums which runs from May - September and will be hosting regular trips up to some of the coolest beached in New York like the Rockaway's, Gilgo Beach, and Ditch Plains.

This is a real deal club and we're looking for a solid crew of members to have an awesome time with! Looking forward to meeting you all!

Love and Peace from your friends at Go Wild NYC!

results.description:
The Brooklyn HubSpot User Group (HUG) is a community of Inbound marketing professionals and business owners. Some of us have been using HubSpot for years, some of us run marketing agencies, and some are just starting to learn about Inbound. If you love networking and exploring new ways to grow your business, join us for a meetup!

Do I have to be a HubSpot User?

Nope! In addition to current users, we welcome anyone interested in learning more about HubSpot or Inbound Marketing in general. That said, our agenda will typically include a deep-dive into some aspect of the HubSpot tools, or a customer case study.

Is this Going to be a Sales Pitch?

No! The sole purpose of a HUG is to get together and learn the best of HubSpot from one another. A basic tenet of Inbound Marketing is understanding that people hate being sold to. We earn trust through education.

What's a Typical HUG Agenda Like?

All HubSpot user groups follow a similar agenda, which includes networking, an educational presentation, and a group discussion. At least twice each year we'll also have guest speakers from HubSpot headquarters join us! Our meetups are casual, helpful, and provide members with complimentary food, drinks and HubSpot SWAG.

What Should I Bring to the Meet-Up?

Business cards for networking, something to take notes (Wifi will be available, if you want to bring a laptop or tablet), and an open mind for learning and sharing.

Can My Company Host a Meet-Up?

Absolutely! One of the more challenging aspects of meetup planning is finding space, so if your company can accommodate a group of 30+, let's chat. We require a location our members can get to easily via major subway lines, high-speed Wifi, a large presentation monitor (or a large screen and laptop projector), enough space for networking, and the ability to bring in food and drinks. In exchange for your hospitality, we'll include your logo and link to your site on our registration landing page, as well as social media promotion. Email bklynhug@gmail.com to start a conversation!
results.name: Brooklyn HubSpot User Group

Our structure is based on the personal success books/models of masterminds like John Maxwell, Napoleon Hill, etc.  We will incorporate the tools and techniques prescribed in their modules to guide, enlighten and direct us to right thinking and commitment to personal action. 

This group is for: individuals who desire to build and grow their potential;  people who are looking for a support team to engage in helping, stretching, giving and receiving to one another of one's talents, gifts and purpose.

"You can have everything in life that you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want" -- Zig Ziglar

Stop trying to grow it alone. Decide this day to Get It Done!

We will also volunteer in our communities and at campaign Headquarters to support the candidate and touch other crucial primary states. We WILL build long-lasting relationships that focus on making our community a better place through national policy on the Federal, State and Local levels! Hope to "meet up" with you soon!

This group is for anyone who is interested in learning and developing Psychic abilities through Tarot cards, Angels cards, Spirit drawings and Evidential Mediumship (EM). EM is bringing messages from love one in spirit. Developing your senses such as the 5 Clairs-Clairaudience, Clairsentience, Clairvoyance,Clairalience & Clairgustance  and will help you give unique evidence that will have everyone truly know that spirit is with them.

As the group facilitator and the founder of Supreme Soul Healing and Learning Center, Dolores Rilho is a Professional Psychic Medium. She has studied with the finest psychic mediums, as well as studied at the famous Arthur Finlay Psychic College in England, Journey Within, Montclair Metaphysical Center. Supreme Soul Healing and Learning Center has an extensive menu of Spiritual development class in South Jersey. 

About the Group: The group meet-ups meet weekly. Each meet-ups will last approximately two hours.7:00pm—9pm. Each session will include group exercises to help us explore and validate our abilities and to develop further. 

A few of the topic we’ll be discussing are Spirit Communications, Inspirational Writing, meditation, message circles, and a lot more. You must be over 18. If you are under the age of 18, please call to discuss your development and ability to sit. $20.00 per meet-up unless noted otherwise How to Join: If you are interested in joining the group please send a request and a little information about yourself. results.description:
This group is for people with love for the urban sport of handball.  Since I couldn't find a group on here for myself, I thought I'd start one up.  Although the group is open to all levels, I would like to keep the pace casual.  Let it be a group for people who just want to meet up and play; exercise, socialize, all that good stuff.  I just hit forty years old and it's difficult to find mature people to play with.  You would find that I have a deep personal attachment to the game.

  I call the group 'Wall Network' because there are walls located all over NYC and Meet Ups can happen anywhere.  I'm only organizer of this group because I started it; but my hope is that people will join, get talking, and post some friendly challenges.  You come to me; I come to  you.   I love exploring new parks and discovering their walls.  Maybe you have a cool one by you, or maybe we can all discover one together.  As it stands now, it's just me, so I guess I'll have to start by posting where i'll be and when.  Anyone's welcome to call 'Next!'
results.name: NYC Wall Network

New York and New Jersey’s businesses and non-profits as well as educational and governmental institutions all face the same dilemma. Human resource departments throughout the region are unable to fill hundreds of vacancies for highly qualified bilingual and technical professionals. Yet the fact that this shortage of staffing is occurring at the same time that thousands of experienced bilingual and technical candidates are unemployed, deserves attention.

To help address said employment challenges, the New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network Is creating this community of professionals with bilingual capabilities and/ or or tech experience/training.

The New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network will organize networking meetups to enable members to discover new career opportunities, and on occasion obtain useful professional development too! Members will benefit from face to face networking with peers, expanding local businesses, non-profits and government institutions to gain knowledge and insight into future employment as well career training opportunities. 

 The New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network welcomes your thoughts, suggestions, and recommendations as well as sponsorship inquires and wishes success to all!

results.description: New York City isn't the easiest or friendliest place to fly RC airplanes. We don't have the luxury of wide open fields with no one around to bother. I am a member of a local aviation club, but it can take up an hour or longer each way to get there and it just isn't always practical. I like to fly small to larger airplanes as well. I've found that some respectful and cautious local flying in NYC can be possible if we really respect our surroundings and don't do stupid things. This meetup is only for RC Airplanes and unfortunately no Quadcopters or Drones. I own and enjoy some myself, but the reckless use of these had shed a negative light on the hobby and there are other groups for that. My aim is to gather some quiet, respectful and fun people to fly our planes as close to or in Manhattan without causing any issues and flying places which don't violate restrictions. I have a whole series of future events and plans that I am working on but this is a simple start.
results.name: New York Radio Control Airplanes Meetup

results.description:
This is an experimental Meetup group for those of us who do things a bit more impromptu: we might wake up on a Saturday morning and decide to go rock climbing or hiking; or we thought we were going to have a mellow weekend but get a little restless. We text our friends but it's too last minute -- gosh darn those planners! This Meetup group is intended to bring us together and make those spontaneous adventures a little more social. 

We will organize monthly Meetups - happy hours, picnics, etc.: larger events where people in the group can get together and meet. For regular activities, we will use the Okk app (http://okk.co). It's better suited for bringing together small groups of people in a more impromptu fashion and allows groups to organize and chat without having to share your phone number or email. Post your activity using the #nycsp hashtag so members can more easily find them! 

Once we get our regular happy hours going, our hope is that we will be able to greatly extend each others’ social circles with more familiar faces and have a larger network to draw from when we decide to do something spur of the moment! Looking forward to meeting everyone!
results.name: New York City Spontaneous People (20s to 30s)

results.description:
Calling all novel nerds and literature ladies! Welcome to FICTION ADDICTION, an ensemble of young women (aged 20-35) who read, gather, and drink. Our fiction addiction is fed by a novel and a graphic novel each month. Meeting locations are chosen based on the theme of the book and proximity to multiple train stations. 

Each month we decide on a theme. Will it be murder, graphic novel memoirs, dystopian fiction, or fearless female leads? It's up to you to decide! Once chosen, the group is given 5 choices for that month's read. For those avid readers who need MORE to read, in between each monthly book club is a separate cultured comic club who reads a graphic novel. 

Perhaps the next Meetup will be held at a 1920s speakeasy, a Victorian parlor, a warm biergarten, or a back alley apothecary. It's up to you to decide! 

So pull a book off your shelf, crack that spine, pour yourself a glass of wine and start reading with us! 

"A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies." - George R.R. Martin
results.name: Fiction Addiction: Women Hooked on Books

results.description:
The NYSA group meets for an extraordinary odyssey into a healing sound-scape for a deeper meditation, renewed inspiration and greater enlightenment fostering inner harmony and tuning in to the music of our own souls.

Hello, I AM Sunny Quetzacoatl. I AM native to the high desert of central Mexico, of Toltec ancestry, born in the land of the Chichimeca. I recently relocated to New York from Los Angeles, CA. and I look forward to contributing sound vibration therapy as a healing art modality. I offer to guide my fellow sound alchemists into a beautiful dream through which we will all reach a zero point state of being. My intention for NY Sound Alchemy is to create a comfortable, invigorating, magical, mysterious, and healing "sound-bath/sound-scape" for my guests. I will play several instruments to relax you and inspire you.

I seek to activate your 6 senses. I will offer organic vegan friendly cacao tea and oils to activate the senses accordingly. Very minor adjustments of shoulders before during or after to those who ask. Sage & Palo Santo may also be used.

My sonidos curanderos will help wash away all stress, worry and discomfort and the vibrations within our space will unlock your imagination. Together, through breath and sound, we will create a perfect sound-scape; a sonic, phonic arena for your spirit to travel to and through. I invite you to join me and my fellow NY Sonic Shamanic alchemists as we travel with the mind, body and spirit by being present w stillness and contributing a steady thorough breath.

Guy Douglas "The Gong Man", "DEEP Exhale"/LA and "Sonic Shamanic"/LIB-DoLab-SoCal. are my soundscape progenitors; and what I contribute is a nexus of deep rooted tribal vibrations and an oscillation of fluid, elastic, Cosmic pulsations. You will be raptured by the sounds of a Live Native American flute, Didgeridoo drone pipe, Ocean wave drum, Crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, rain monsoon tower, thunder-maker, serpent rattle, and a sometimes (as inspired) very special Sun language orison; a vernacular tongue which you may surprisingly recognize. Welcome to the New York Sound Alchemisty movement.
results.name: New York Sound Alchemy

I formed this group because I'm tired of creating only those things that yield a paycheck. I want to implement the money-sink ideas that I've imprisoned to the "someday" room in my mind. The first of these ideas is an autonomous underwater vehicle with the purpose of exploring the waters around Manhattan. If you're interested in working on this, you should definitely join. results.description:
It's not a typo! Wallyball is a fun and exciting sport that has recently become more popular in the NYC area and even though it derives from volleyball, it has its own rules: It is played on a racquetball court, in teams of 3, but the reason it is so enjoyable is that players are allowed to play the ball off of the side walls' bounce.

For all of you, volleyball junkies, this is a great way to challenge your game. 

For those of you who are fairly new to volleyball, you can be sure that you will have a great time while you're working your butts off!

You have two options to choose from:

 1. Join a team and participate in the only official Wallyball League in New York City. 

2. Join as an individual member and come to our open plays every Monday and Wednesday night. 


For details, visit: http://www.nyvolleyballinstitute.com/

results.description:
Join us on Saturdays in Church Square Park for a fun filled class to learn classic boxing techniques with cross training fitness emphasis.

Class Fee $10 per person  for the 1 hour Boxing Session

If you want to play you must bring the gear of the pro's:

• Boxing gloves

• Hand wraps/ Wrap gloves

• Workout clothes / sneakers

• Towel 

• Bottle of water

• Optional equipment Boxing mitts and jump rope ( if you have them bring them-the more the merrier)

Boxing SGT (small group training) class break down:

• 5 - 10min park / workout area run

• Jump rope / plyometric warmup (burpees,  jump squats, ladder drills etc..)

• Focus mitts work ( boxers punching mitts technique drills )

• Semi-contact ; you and your partner strike the pads using time tested boxing techniques (no this is not a cardio kickboxing dance class )

• 3 minutes rounds and 30 second active rest ( push-ups, squat jumps, running in place etc..)

• Partner drills (medicine ball , resistance bands , kettle-bells etc..)
results.name: Hoboken Boxing Class Meetup

results.description:
The Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce Meetup Group provides business owners, entrepreneurs, and professional service providers a forum to share ideas, strategies, discuss problems, and explore opportunities that will help grow businesses and increase profits.

We meet monthly. Topics will include branding, social media, negotiating, presentation skills, marketing, workplace communication, financial controls, technology, cyber-security, hacking, and risk management. The Fort Lee business community is fortunate to have many experts in these fields. A meeting could include a guest presentation, a discussion panel or table set up for questions and answers with one of these people.

This Group is about the exchange of ideas with other liked-minded business professionals who want to advance their knowledge and awareness of what it takes to succeed in today's fast changing business environment. Looking to share your business experience? Looking to pick up some new ideas? That’s what we’re all about. 

This is not a networking group or a place to get leads. There is, however, an opportunity to make new connections.  This is not the place to make your sales pitch, although your sales method can be an interesting subject to discuss with other sales professionals. Sharing ideas openly with others on what works, and what doesn’t, can improve your game.

For over 65 years the Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce has been promoting and supporting our business community. This is an exciting time for Fort Lee as we experience a renaissance of new business and residential growth. This Group is not limited to members of the Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce. It’s open to all businesses and their employees.

We invite you to join us to share your ideas and experiences as well as your questions and concerns, and become part of Fort Lee’s exciting future.

 Thank you for your time,

 Respectfully,

 FORT LEE REGIONAL CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
results.name: Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce Meetup Group

topics.name: National Politics-What Direction Are We Headed In

results.description: We are a group that aims to create and collaborate on initiatives that will strengthen the lives of others. Disruption may be the buzzword these days, but we believe that our society is already disrupted and polarized to a dangerous degree. To that end, we want to bridge the gaps that may jeopardize the health and vitality of this and future generations. We will use new tools to fulfill time-tested objectives. To name but a few: - A reliable, non-partisan database for where political candidates stand. Beneath all the spin and style, what is the substance? - An app where state and local governments can hear of infrastructure-related complaints from drivers. Also a way for people to crowd-source funding for infrastructure projects like decaying bridges. - A system where needy school districts - such as those afflicted by natural disasters - can acquire the resources and support for quality extracurricular programs. For example, one of its efforts shall try to provide musical instruments to schoolchildren, that they may discover their creativity and our rich musical heritage. For these and other endeavors, we seek contributors of various types. From the entrepreneurs who can strengthen the intellectual and moral foundations, to the advisors who can provide technical support and expertise, to the coders who can bring these endeavors to life (and even teach the code neophytes a thing or two!) - we happily welcome you into this community. A community which strives to foster and strengthen our communities.

What is Happiness: What Makes Us Happy

results.description:
About Happiness Clubs

A Happiness Club is a monthly forum with the sole mission of promoting the benefits and scientifically-proven theories of Happiness and Positive Psychology.  Meetings feature inspirational speakers who will introduce us to different happiness boosting techniques and ways we can increase our emotional and physical wellbeing. 

Happiness is an inner state of well-being that empowers an individual to be their best possible self, and we could all use a little more!

Positive Psychology is the scientific study of human flourishing, and an applied approach to optimal functioning. It has been defined as the study of the strengths and virtues that enable individuals, communities and organizations to thrive.  So, let's explore this together!

There are approximately 140 Happiness Clubs worldwide, including a number of them in Connecticut with long-standing histories within their communities.

For more information: http://happinessclub.com

About the Facilitator

Donna Vella is a healthy lifestyle and positivity advocate.  She is a 2012 graduate of the Institute for Integrative Nutrition and is a Certified Holistic Health Coach. She is currently studying Positive Psychology under Dr. Tal Ben-Shahar and is pursuing a second career as a Happiness Ambassador and Positive Psychology Coach. Donna is a volunteer for The Orthopaedic Foundation for Active Lifestyles, Slow Food USA/Fairfield County, former Team Captain – WalkTheWalk America, and was known as “Dr. Ima CrackUp, the Tender Heart Specialist” in Stamford Hospital’s Health and Humor Associates (HAHA) Caregiving Clown Program.

For the last 25 years, Donna has kept corporate CEOs and senior executives organized.  She is currently the office manager for a Stamford, CT. based commodities trading firm.  Donna was born and raised in upstate New York and is a graduate of the Rochester Institute of Technology.  She lives in Stamford with her husband, Mike.
results.name: Stamford Positive Living Forum

results.description:
Purpose of the Group

The purpose of this group is to provide all levels of spiritual seekers a practical and effective means of manifesting to higher levels of consciousness. Consciousness in this sense can be defined as the level of one's awareness of reality. Those who truly seek greater truths and are Willing to surrender preconceived notions, beliefs, ideas, opinions, and views are guaranteed an advancement in their own awareness. Those who say they are willing but still cling to various instilled beliefs and illusory fears due to past experiences, are not guaranteed the same outcome.

• Willingness = readiness, plus personal conviction to affect a change through trust in a higher power greater than oneself.

• Surrender = release, relinquish, or give up any beliefs, opinions, or ideas that one believes to be true about oneself, others, life and the world.


Intention of Meetings

The intention of each meeting is to provide spiritual principles that one may practice in life to attain higher levels of awareness/consciousness.­ The concordant practices and principles encompass a variety of teachings throughout human history that when adhered to can lead to the state known as enlightenment or bliss. In reality, all the teachings are essentially the same thing varying only in culture, location, time period, etc... Therefore, the agenda is to present the principles and facilitate an understanding of them and the means by which they can be used with the current life circumstances members would like to address.
results.name: Consciousness Transcended

Are you into mixing martial arts and marijuana? We are!
Tired of having to worry about your friends from the mat smelling your medicine in your dank gym bag? We are!
Are you interested in martial arts but afraid to try them because you are afraid of being caught high or with weed? We are!
Are you sick of couch-lock? We aren't! But do that after we work out! : )
Are you tired of all the lies about marijuana and stereotypes about stoners? We are!
Are you tired of the cycle of getting high, just to get by, just to get high? We are!
Do you use marijuana and recreation as preventative medicine like we do?
Are you willing to wait another 6 to 7 years for recreational marijuana to become legal in NY? WE ARE NOT!!!
Would you like to stay fit and fight for your 420 rights right now!?!
If so than please join us!


Press Hits

results.description:
This all-girls group is aimed at professional career-oriented women aged 31-45 to meet for brunch, dinner, happy hours, movies, impromptu picnics in Manhattan and surrounding boroughs. I'm 38 so I decided to go up 7 years and down 7 years to ensure a good range of age for potential life-long friends. This group will encourage members to form new and lasting friendships with other like-minded career-oriented women in the similar age bracket of 31-45. 

With that said, I hope to have a meetup at least once a week for a total of 4-5 meetups each month (ranging from brunch, dinner, happy hour to dinner and a movie, Friday afternoon lunch, etc) for small intimate parties of 6-10. There is a $3 meetup fee that will be collected offline at the end of the meetup when the bill arrives. It will be used to offset the meetup organizational costs ($180 per year for running a group). Please bring enough cash to cover this. If you sign up for a meetup and fail to show up (2) times or cancel within 2 days of the meetup, you will be removed from this group and banned. No exceptions so only sign up if you are sure you can make the meetup.

A recognizable photo picture on your profile and answers to all my profile questions are required in order to be allowed into the group. I will cap group membership at 100-110 women, and keep active members only  in order to keep the group manageable. If you do not agree to the above rules and regulations, feel free not to join my group - there are thousands of other meetup groups so if my rules offput you, you are welcome to not join it and find another group more suited to your needs.

Hope to see you soon at a meetup!

results.description:
Reading is usually a solitary "activity", and when people read in groups, they are usually reading the same book. We are going to try something different; we will get together, read a book of our own choosing (you must bring your own book), and afterward, each member will explain to the group:

1. What compelled you to choose the book that you were reading.

2. What are your learning from the book, and how are you applying it to life.

3. Convince other members, why they should read the book.

In life, you can never tell others what to read, listen to, or watch; their lives, and their desires lead them toward discovering themselves, but you can influence them, and even if they do not follow your lead immediately, they may do so in the future when the need arises. I often see people reading books, and I want to know what they are reading, and why they are reading it. What you are compelled to read, or avoid reading is a reflection of you. It not only matters that you read, what you read matters! Join me at the New York Public Library Schwarzman Building, as I sit among the tourists, and enjoy the works of the masters, and give them their due, by immersing myself in their works. At the conclusion of the 2 hours, we will share our thoughts (each member receiving 5 minutes of time, and I getting the last word before we conclude) about what we are reading, and hopefully we will be able to inspire each other.

Join me, and we will travel into the minds of others, use their knowledge, and wisdom to improve ourselves, our lives, and the world that enabled us to be!

I just want to warn you guys, that prior to attending this event, I will be practicing Krav Maga. Only a true badass, can practice kicking ass, and then sit down, and enjoy reading a book, while lesser men, resist reading, and want to fight. You can't do the latter without the former, or else the consequences will be severe for you!

This group requires is fee-based (pay-to-play), because I want you to invest in this group, and what we are doing. If you value something that someone is doing, you will reward that person. Fees paid also serve to motivation for me to be more creative, and put forth more effort to give you your monies worth, because I know that someone wants the service. This also compels you to be more attentive to me as you expect your monies worth.

I am not in the business of collecting members. If you are in the business of playing games, don't waste my time, and test my patience. Don't waste your time. Behave with purpose, go places, do things, and meet others. I want you to value yourself. Join me, and let's work to make this group great, for everyone! See you soon...
results.name: R-E-A-D; to be a badass!

results.description: "Abante" is Latin for "advance", a word which is both an action and a description. To push in every way to do the next thing, to form the collaboration for greatness in every industry, to dream and realize beyond what is as the new avante garde. results.description:
We believe that books have the ability to transform lives! 

Join us for lively discussions of books that inspire, motivate and help us live our best lives. We focus on self-help, personal development and spirituality books. 

Reading groups enhance the reading experience by creating a community of people who help you expand your consciousness. We started this group because we wanted to create a space where people who like to read soul-stirring books could come together to share our thoughts and experiences. It will also be a great place to meet new people and create new friendships. 

Some of the authors we’ll be reading who represent this genre are:

Joel Osteen ~ Wayne Dyer ~ Eckhart Tolle ~ Don Miguel Ruiz ~ Thich Nhat Hanh ~ Deepak Chopra ~ Pema Chodron ~ Gary Zukav ~ Ram Dass ~ Dalai Lama ~ Byron Katie ~ Marianne Williamson ~ Michael Bernard Beckwith ~ Harville Hendrix ~ and many others 

We meet in midtown Manhattan the 2nd Sunday of the month at 3 pm. 

Members are encouraged, but not required, to select and host a book at a monthly meeting. This responsibility will be rotated each month. As the discussion leader for the book you select, you're expected to provide 3-5 questions for the group to discuss. Discussion questions can be found at the end of the book , at the author's website , at the publisher's website , by Googling the title of the book , or by creating your own questions. Please check to see if the book you're hosting is available at the library for those who prefer to borrow rather than buy. The library websites are: nypl.org , bklynlibrary.org , queenslibrary.org 

Members are also expected to have read the book before the meeting so you can contribute to the discussion in a meaningful way. 

If you too believe that shared reading will enhance your reading experience, please consider joining us.
results.name: Live Your Best Life Book Club

results.description:
Meetup purpose

Sometimes we are not strong enough by ourselves to change our ways, or to kick bad habits. I started this group because I want people to be supporters of each other. Help each other change their ways, form new habits, and live a happier life. Support can then become like a life line that is used to keep yourself motivated. It's helpful to know you are not alone in what keeps you from changing your ways, and to hear other people's stories. Let's gather, let's talk about it, and most importantly let's Kick "it"(bad habits).


Who should join?

This is a group for all the people who are fed up with their bad habits, and finally want to kick them to the curve. Whether it's eating, exercising, communicating, thinking, speaking, smoking, or any bad habit , kick it! This includes those moments when you let people take advantage of you, or are very passive. If it's not making you a better person then it has to go.


Why should you join?

You should join if you like to join others in their fight to free themselves from the imprisonment of bad habits! You never know who you might help , or who might  help you.
results.name: Just Kicking it(Bad Habits) Meetup Group

results.description: Hi my name is Amanda Pacheco and I am a recent college graduate from Rutgers University. Moving home from college can be difficult transition therefore I'm looking forward to meeting some young powerful women in the Jersey city and New York Area. Im hoping to have some fun events! And build a close sisterhood of friends.

results.description:
Have you ever thought about being a part of something supportive, motivational, encouraging, and feeds you spiritually? Have you ever thought about being a part of something that you can meet new friends and discuss different topics concerning life? Have you ever felt like just leaving significant other at home, and just letting your hair down to hang out with the girls? Are you tired of just hanging with kids all day and just want to be grown for one night without children? If you answered yes to any of these questions, put on that little black dress, pull and dust those heels out of the closet, let your hair down and come and hang out the the D.W.W.A.C. We are Diva's With Wisdom and Class! This group was formed because there is a serious need for coming together as women. We want to uplift, share our hearts, dreams and desires and to have girls night out on the town. We want to grow together and learn who we are, whose we are and know our worth. We are a group for women of color primarily between the ages of mid 20's and above, we are interested in creating lasting friendships, meeting positive and intelligent women of color who are also trying to build new friendships through participating in a multitude of activities and most importantly by having fun. Every month you will have the opportunity to connect with POWERFUL, ENERGETIC, DYNAMIC, VIRTUOUS women that wants to build lasting relationships, collaborate, support, network, and share an amazing moment with YOU!

We consider ourselves DIVAS, not because of our looks, not because of our figures. We consider ourselves DIVAS because to us the meaning of a DIVA is someone who is strong, confident and feels very comfortable in her own skin. A DIVA is not only a dreamer, but a visionary, she sees what she wants and strives to achieve that very thing.
results.name: D.W.W.A.C (Diva's With Wisdom and Class)

results.description:
We all know that Millennial Entrepreneurs  (Entrepreneurs born between 1981-2000) are driven by Passion, Purpose, Happiness and Success.

Those four characteristics sometime lead us to become overworked and sheltered from having a great time. 

The Millennial Entrepreneur's Club changes the rules to the game! 

As a member of the club here's what you can expect:


• The opportunity to share the challenges of being an Millennial Entrepreneur

• Exponential growth in your business by exchanging ideas & forming accountablity partnerships

• Yearly Private Mastermind Retreats 

• Access to a Experienced Business mentors

• Free membership E-Learning Platform

• Exclusive access to Webinar and Podcast Interviews and Trainings

• Opportunity to participate in and attend annual live conferences

• And Much More! 



As a member of M.E.C, you'll have the opportunity to unwind in an Ultra- Luxurious environment with other like minded Millennial Entrepreneurs every month on Millennial Monday's.

You will have the opportunity to Mingle, Build Relationships and possible Business Alliances with other Next Generation Billionaires of the globe all while having the time of your life!

When you're in the Millennial Entrepreneurs Club your success is guaranteed!

 A Welcome to the Dream Team of Millennial Entrepreneurship

results.description:
One habit that a significant percentage of successful people have in common is engaging in some kind of meditative practice. From billionaire investors, to elite athletes, to Hollywood moguls, to dating gurus, to gun-slinging entrepreneurs, meditation comes up again and again as a practice they attribute much of their success to. And yet, many young professionals in today's fast-paced world are turned off by the practice of meditation due to the strong religious connotations with which it is taught. 

My goal in this meetup group to to lead guided sessions for the modern New Yorker.  We will take traditional meditation and related practices (Zen meditation, Transcendental Meditation, Yoga Nidra, Pranayam) and explore them in a rigorous, scientific way, while maintaining their ancient and everlasting qualities. 

Sessions will include survey courses that cover a range of different meditative practices to course that go deep into particular types of practice. Eventually, we will plan retreats (weekends or longer) to different beautiful parts of the US.
results.name: Meditation for the Modern New Yorker

We meet in the middle of the day and/or in the evening Monday – Friday. 

Locations for our meetings will vary according to what book we’re currently reading – e.g.: a book set near the ocean may inspire us to lunch at a beach. Occasionally we’re up for adventures beyond discussing books; we love to eat and drink, see a movie, get our spa on, take a salsa lesson, hit a comedy club or picnic in Central Park. Join us and let’s delve into our next book together!

Regards, Peaches and Angela H.

Some workshops will show workflows from desktop GIS using QGIS to pushing the data to shareable web maps. Besides our open hours, CartoCampNYC will be teaching and hosting workshops and presentations on modern web mapping from the NYC community and beyond. We will also be having high school classes in for field trips!

CartoCampNYC is a place for mappers to come and enjoy open hours with the CartoDB team and a central hub for information about upcoming CartoDB community events. For other great regular meetups in the city, checkout Maptime NYC, GeoNYC, and BetaNYC.

Our curriculum is based on the Tri-V formula of Pekiti Tirsia Kali, and allows students to learn the entire system, including all weapon categories and methods. The class environment is light-natured and safety in training is emphasized. Students progress at their own pace. 

Group Info:

PTK NJ Elite Kalipunan is part of the Pekiti Tirsia Tactical Association, PTK Elite and PTK NJ Family. Named and authorized by Tuhon Rommel Tortal, Pekiti Tirsia NJ Elite Kalipunan will carry on the Pekiti Tirsia tradition of vigorous training, complete tactical awareness, and values of life, success and good health. 

"Kalipunan" was the term given to a village or tribe of strong warriors, Here at PTK NJ Elite we are building our Elite Family or "Kalipunan". 

Please visit PTKbrooklyn.com for more info or contact us via email PTKElite@gmail.com.

results.description:
Teach + Learn, Actually Networking.

We are a conscious community of professionals and entrepreneurs who freely share our resources and ourselves. Real conversations with people of all industries with one common goal: success through networking.

Members of our conscious community hold two principles true:

1)	Success at work and in business is measured by the quality of their connections, so they actively share access to information, resources, and contacts with other members of the community
2)	Success first begins with a focus on personal and professional development. We support each other through the improvement of our business and work skills.

No high pressure sales pitches or hidden agendas! Teach + Learn promotes RELATIONSHIP BUILDING instead of passing out business cards.

Professionals of all ages, abilities, and industries are WELCOME! We believe that the key to success is having people of all backgrounds in your network.

Our networking is FACILITATED. Make the most of your mingling with ice breakers and other activities to keep the conversation rolling.

Our community is free to join and even better when you participate in the conversation. Join us at an event or become part of our free secret Facebook page to have direct access to job posts, expert career advice, and professional development materials.

Looking forward to teaching and learning with you!
results.name: Teach + Learn: Manhattan Chapter

We are looking forward to meet regularly in New York City and hold conference calls, google hangouts, etc. for those that can't travel to the Big Apple.

This psychotherapy group will help you adequately grieve the loss of your relationship with an ex (wife, husband, girlfriend, boyfriend, lover, partner, etc) and move forward with your life. results.description: The group meets at Angelina's Restaurant in Tuckahoe for dinner and an interactive lessons on the opera "Tosca". The format will be as follows; three sessions meeting Oct. 5th, Oct. 12th and Oct. 19th. Dinner beginning at 5:30 p.m., lessons on the opera "Tosca" from 6:30 - 7:30 p.m., dessert from 7:30 to 8:00 p.m. Excursion to Metropolitian Opera matinee on Oct. 24th at 1:00 p.m. followed by dinner at Angelina's Restaurant. Participants will receive a CD recording of Puccini's "Tosca" and round trip transportation will be arranged. Follow up celebration on Oct. 26th at Angelina's Restaurant to process the experience. Lessons will be presented by Professor Joan Adinolfi Mallory. Head of Music Education Department, Nyack College.

results.description:
In an article in Brick Underground  Magazine Jonathan Miller of Miller Samuel says, "More brand new condos are hitting the market, increasing the supply of apartments overall, and interest rates are still "hovering at near-record lows,".

Now is the time to get into Real Estate before these interest rate record lows increase, and you miss out on a great opportunity. 

Are you interested in becoming part of a rapidly growing community of successful local Real Estate investors, who are securing the benefits of a once in a life time Buyers market? 

Right here and now we are in a unique Real Estate buyers market which is fueling the rapid growth of our community of investors. With the intermingling of record low mortgage rates and lowered housing prices, our group is slaying in this market. You can look it up, the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to invest in real estate. At our investors gathering we discuss not only why, but how there are more millionaires created through real estate than any other industry.

You will have the opportunity to:

*Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Lease Options, Buy and Hold, Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures and REOs, Short Sales, Multi-Family Dwellings, Commercial and far more.

*Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax redeemable strategies out there.

*Get locally mentored and coached by the best.

*LEARN how to go from an investor that is only making a little extra money and still working for someone else, to a SUCCESSFUL Real Estate Investor who controls their life. Where you make and has the option to never work a 9-5 again.

*Find out how you can EARN substantial income while you LEARN how to invest in Real Estate.

*Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors.

*And so much more. 

Each REI community meeting is distinctive as we show you different transactions we've accomplished recently. We will also show you how you can be included in deals. 

Some of our team invest part time for lasting income while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS and invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to do this and more, please RSVP. We have a nationwide network of Real Estate Investors in addition to our local team in the NY Metro Area that will show you how.

PLEASE ANSWER RSVP QUESTIONS TO RECEIVE ADDRESS TO OUR NEXT LIFE CHANGING EVENT!
results.name: Real Estate Investing for Financial Freedom

Class topics range from general health and body alignment to migraines, scoliosis, back pain, shoulder pain, walking issues, breathing, and stress just to name a few. Many people with auto-immune diseases such as Crohn's and arthritis can benefit greatly from these classes as well. Our goal is to heal the world of chronic pain so please come even if you don't see your ailment listed and we will work with you.

results.description: Still Waters in a Storm is a one-room schoolhouse in Bushwick, Brooklyn, a reading and writing sanctuary for neighborhood children of Spanish-speaking immigrants living in poverty. It's beautiful! We need kind, patient adult volunteers to sit next to children and encourage them as they write.

results.description: We are a women's chorus of about forty women, based on Long Island. If you can sing, and want to join a warm, talented, passionate, and fun group of singers, please take a look at our Join Us page. Our group has been rehearsing and performing for Long Island audiences for 52 years! We rehearse every week with our brilliant, talented and energetic Co-Directors, Christine Krowles and Connie Kash. They teach us our songs in many ways, for the different ways we learn, and help us to sound and look our best. If you like to sing, and would like to learn about barbershop singing, please give us a call. We rehearse every Thursday night from 7:15 until about 9:45 at the Good Shepherd Lutheran Church on Hempstead Turnpike in Levittown. Our chorus is not affiliated with the church - we just rent space. We invite women who want to learn about this great hobby to visit us most any Thursday. If you would like to learn more, please call or text Bobbi: 516-983-2128, or Annette: 631-729-7067 for more information.

We are looking to build a community of artist, of all ages and backgrounds, to come together and share their talents in a friendly, open and supportive environment. Our meetings will take place at St. Bartholomew's in White Plains, a beautiful 100 year old stone church with fantastic acoustics and beautiful stain glass windows. Each month a guest performer, (chosen from the membership) will open the show. This will be a great opportunity for some of our braver members to really show-off their talents. Then each musician, singer, poet, or comedian will have about 10 minutes to perform (depending on turn-out). A sound system and microphones will be provided.

So join us on the 3rd Wednesday of each month from 6 - 9pm, and play, sing, listen, laugh or just have a great time. All ages, old and young, beginner to advanced, are welcome so bring your friends and family.                                                        

A $2.00  suggested donation is requested to performer (to defray admin. fees).                                                Light fare and beverages will be on sale with a portion of the proceeds going to local charities.

results.description:
This meetup group can be described with 2 words : Serendipity + Francophilia !

Francophilia : for those who have learned (years ago) or are learning French and want to practice and improve their conversation skills in a fun and enjoyable way with native French speakers. Also for Francophone people visiting New York, it can be a nice way to discover the city and speak French with Americans/locals!

Serendipity : During nice weather, we might do things outdoors like : going for a hike upstate (e.g.: Cold Springs, the Croton Aqueduct ; walking along the Bronx River, the NJ Palisades or along the Walt Whitman trail...) ; or exploring landmarks in the city or special places like the Chinatown of Flushing, or Coney/City Island. We could also just meet in a beautiful place like the Cloisters, Governor's Island, Lyndhurst's Rose Garden or Untermeyer Park for a picnic, enjoy a sunset in a dramatic landscape, or watch an outdoor movie. In winter or rainy weather we could visit a wing of the MET or explore the art in the metro, or even just meet for a drink in a speakeasy bar. Any activity can be an « excuse » to practice your French in a non-formal setting. The idea is to practice conversation with diversified topics/environments and currents events, popular culture, politics, economics, news, etc. We can also discuss French literature and newspaper/magazine articles and editorials. For instance a visit to sites of the Harlem Renaissance or Columbia University or the Jumel Mansion could be an opportunity to enrich ourselves with our mutual histories, all while conversing in French!

I have plenty of places in mind for our Voyages ! Alors a bientôt !
results.name: French conversation in NY - An Invitation to the Voyage !

results.description:
This group is for classical chamber musicians who would like to play with other musicians in weekly sessions with the guidance of professional coaches. The program is run by Alaria Chamber Ensemble, a well-known ensemble that has been in existence for 33 years and performs regularly at Bargemusic and at Weill Hall. Yuri Vodovoz, violinist and music director of Alaria, creates well matched chamber groups and duo-sonata classes. All instruments and all levels are welcome. Classes meet for two hour sessions, once a week, on Mondays and Wednesdays.

This meetup has several purposes:  to assist musicians to meet others  and play with a variety of other musicians;  to give musicians a chance to learn new music and hone their skills;  to meet and make new musical friends;  and to gives musicians a chance to challenge themselves while working with others.

The semester will include a master class by Mark Peskanov, Director of Bargemusic.

The Fall Session will run from Sept. 14 to December 15. There will be an open audition on Monday, Aug. 31, at 7 pm, at 244 West 54th Street, 10th Floor. Attendance at the audition creates no obligation to join the class, but gives you an opportunity to hear other students, to present a sample of your work and to decide if this class is a good match for you. Please contact Yuri Vodovoz at 917 860-7727 if you plan to attend the audition, if you would like to make alternate arrangements for an audition, or if you would like addition information about the class.

Tuition for the class is $800.
results.name: New York Chamber Music Classes

results.description:
This group is for ladies in their 20s - early 30s who are in or around the Boerum Hill/Cobble Hill/Carroll Gardens area of Brooklyn and are looking for a group of friends to hang out with. I want this to be a little community of friends in our neighborhood, which can be kind of tough to find. (Sidenote: I hate the BoCoCa abbreviation, but I needed a location-specific name, so we're stuck with it unless someone thinks of something better ;).)

This is going to be super laid back and casual, so if you're in the area and want a cool bunch of girls to grab drinks with, this might be for you.  I want to keep this pretty small and local, so that you guys have a chance to actually get to know each other. Feel free to message me if you have any ideas!

As a note, the name isn't meant to be super specific - ladies from surrounding neighborhoods are totally welcome! I am trying to keep it reasonably local, though, and somewhat within the age range, as the point of this group is to create a local community near where we all live. To all of the guys out there, I'm sure you're amazing, but this group is no boys allowed. 

If you RSVPed yes to an event, but are not longer able to attend, please update your RSVP, ideally at least 24 hours in advance. If you are a no-show at two events in a row or consistently do not show up, you will be dismissed from the group and will have to reapply. 

[Note: If you are applying to join, you need to have a clear photo of yourself as your profile photo, for anti-creeper purposes.]

results.description: This group is for small business entrepreneurs of all types; it's about connecting LOCALLY independently-owned businesses with customers, resources and each other. We are the ONLY business alliance in the Newark area focused on SMALL businesses. Promoting, connecting, advising, advocating on YOUR behalf for greater visibility... OUR FOCUS is LOCALISM and driving $$$ and sustainability to your business. We have a signature event called the ReMIXX every month where we feature an entrepreneur. NOW we'd like to meet to determine how we can better address the opportunities and challenges of the local change maker in a more intimate setting Our Goals 1. Create a strong member network for local innovators, equip them with the resources they need to prosper, create jobs, and function in harmony with local ecosystems. 2. Keep Dollars in the Local Economy/Reduce Capital Leakage – for every $100 spent at a locally-owned business, $73 remains in the local economy, compared to that of a non-locally owned business which only retains $43. We know that entrepreneurship fuels economic innovation and prosperity, and serves as a key means for families to move out of low wage jobs and into the middle class. 3. Increase small business visibility and foster Economic Inclusion; locally owned businesses build strong communities. By sustaining vibrant communities, linking neighbors via economic and social relationships, leading to strong healthy engaged communities. Now is the time to join forces to protect, foster, and strengthen the local businesses in our neighborhoods that give us a sense of place, ensure our diverse culture, and provide us with strong unique communities we are proud to call home
results.name: Newark Forward Ever Business Alliance Meetup

results.description:
Art Fast is an experiment in cultural mapping, a way for people to experience another culture through a medium/practice that they best understand and relate to. The aim is to share the essence of Navratri, a 9-day South-East Asian Hindu festival that celebrates the divine feminine that resides within all beings. Hindus typically fast on these days and immerse themselves in spiritual practices while they engage in community interactions. As part of the cultural mapping process, artists and other creatives will rejuvenate their creative spirits (which the goddess is believed to embody) by fasting on their art practice and engaging in community sharing. 

As you ‘fast’ on your art process, you can enjoy unique South-East Asian inspired festivities in NYC and partake in events that are exclusively organized for the participants and led by acclaimed artists, e.g. art workshops, art exhibit, panel discussion etc. Art Fast is open to all professional artists and creatives (visual artists, writers, performers, filmmakers, creative directors and chefs) living anywhere in the world. If you wish to participate and attend these workshops for free please email: contact.artfast@gmail.com by Oct 10, 2015.
results.name: Rejuvenate the creative spirit in you via ART FAST

Choose a goal that is specific.Together we will create the tools, support, and help you build a week by week road map to sucess!! <br>

By joining this group, you are making a commitment to yourself. Full Circle Writer’s Workshop is where aspiring fiction writers can share their stories in an inviting atmosphere and receive constructive feedback to better their craft. We meet regularly every 3 weeks, for 90 minutes to 2 hours, in the ultra-hip, extra chic area of Astoria, Queens. 

Writers are encouraged to bring an open mind along with their short fiction (or an excerpt from a longer piece) to each meeting while we give each other thoughtful critiques in informal, conversational discussions. You'll hear what works and what may need a little more work. 

Our first meeting will happen on October 17th from 3-4:30 pm. We’ll read, we’ll write, we’ll get better. Come join! You can message me here at Meet Up, or email me at alex@alexclermontwrites.com if you have any questions. To see the few basic ground rules, check out: http://bit.ly/1N2HfER

results.description:
WELCOME TO THE #1 (and only) NEW YORK ICELANDIC LANGUAGE GROUP!

This newly created Icelandic language meetup is open to those with an interest in learning Icelandic, students of the language, as well as native speakers, to join together and practice conversation, while at the same time having fun and interacting socially! 

Here you can come with any questions you have about this very unique language, and have them answered in a unstructured, fun setting - as well as getting tips and pointers on the trickier aspects of the grammar. It is also a supportive space to actually use what you've been learning with others. 

Both a study group and an opportunity for authentic conversation, this supportive and welcoming space is devoted to all Icelandic language enthusiasts! 

You should consider becoming a member of the NEW YORK ICELANDIC LANGUAGE MEETUP...

• If you've brushed up a bit on your Icelandic and would like to try your hand at speaking, then this is the place to be.  

• Perhaps you're a native speaker and haven't spoken Icelandic in ages, then this is the group to join. 

• Are you are a student and would like to ask questions about a particular grammar topic? Feel free to come join us to ask those questions you may be embarrassed to raise your hand in class for.

•  Are you a language enthusiast and were always curious about Icelandic? Then this meetup is for you.

•  Even if you simply have an interest in the country and culture, come on out and join us. We're a very dedicated, energetic and passionate group!

Whatever your level, from novice to native, please join us for gatherings that are casual, friendly, relaxed, and completely bilingual.  Any language enthusiast will be sure to enjoy themselves here, and what better language than Icelandic?

All levels encouraged and welcomed!
results.name: New York Icelandic Language Meetup

results.description: Animosos aficionados al senderismo, que deseen realizar el sendero de los Apalaches (Appalachian Trail), por secciones de uno, dos o tres días de marcha, y esporádicamente algún recorrido de mayor duración, apoyándonos recíprocamente para organizar el inicio y fin de cada trayecto. Es condición hablar o conocer al menos un poco el idioma español, y estar dispuesto a hablarlo durante la actividad, como idioma preferente. Bienvenidos los senderistas anglófonos que deseen practicar su español. Caminaremos en grupo. Es necesario que cada cual tenga su equipo mínimo personal: botas de senderismo de montaña, bastones, mochila, ropa de abrigo según cada estación del año, guantes, etc. En los recorridos de un día, caminaremos secciones de aproximadamente 10 a 14 millas, del Appalachian Trail, con muy poco peso. En los recorridos de dos o tres días, caminaremos distancias algo menores (alrededor de 8 a 10 millas diarias, dependiendo de la facilidad o dificultad de cada recorrido), con la carga mínima, necesaria para transportar el equipo de acampada personal (tienda de campaña, saco de dormir, colchoneta inflable, pequeña cocinilla, comida, agua y útiles de aseo y otros). Cuando el tamaño del grupo lo permita, y haya disponibilidad, utilizaremos también los refugios existentes a lo largo del recorrido.
results.name: New York - Senderismo en español - Appalachian Trail

results.description:
The Actor Headshot Workshops is about how to get the most out of great headshots. Through the workshop, you will learn what you as an actor should know before getting headshots.

Headshots are one of the most important and expensive portfolio requirements for professional actors, so it’s important to go into sessions with a clear vision of what you need and what casting directors and agents are looking for. In this workshop, I’ll guide you through the detailed process of identifying your strengths and avoiding amateur pitfalls, ensuring that you‘ll come away with headshots that represent the best and most dynamic version of you. 

Successful headshot sessions require just as much detailed preparation as that big audition. This workshop will help you avoid common mistakes that cost time, money, and, most importantly, career opportunities!

Photographers, you are welcome to group as well. If you're interested in learning the art of headshots photography. Please join the group and send me a message and I will organize a workshop for photographers.

See samples Headshots here.
results.name: Actor Headshot Workshops

results.description:
In addition to our semi-annual conferences, throughout the year ONUG will conduct smaller user-centered meetings across the country focused on driving open software defined cloud infrastructure. The informal meetups will provide year round opportunities for the existing ONUG Community to engage with new IT leaders and continue the discussion on topics introduced at the semi-annual conferences.

ONUG’s mission is to guide and accelerate the adoption of open software defined cloud infrastructure solutions that meet IT end user requirements as defined through use cases, proof of concepts, and deployments to ensure user needs are met. Throughout the year, ONUG meetups will be attended by members of the ONUG Board, which is comprised of representatives from Bank of America, BNY Mellon, Cigna, Citigroup, Credit Suisse, FedEx, Fidelity Investments, Gap, Inc., Intuit, JPMorgan Chase, the Lippis Report, Morgan Stanley, Pfizer, UBS, and Yahoo.  

For more information on ONUG, visit www.opennetworkingusergroup.com

Tranquil and romantic, Tea Drunk serves in the brewing style that is true to the region where the tea comes from. Even if guests walk in knowing nothing about tea, they will have an unforgettable experience watching the tea prepared at table and opening their taste buds to the possibilities of terroir sourced tea, in the company of a tea pet – a clay drinking buddy.

results.description:
Wannabe Music is a community project set in the New York City area for all ages that is meant to help you collaborate with other musicians and singers. Our services include a website which allows you to add or search for other musicians and singers, contact them discreetly, and help reserve spaces or hold events for musicians to play.

Our goal is to empower you to play music or sing within the community (professional or jamming), and enable you to be an expressed individual through music. Allow you to find a level of individuality that will allow you to change your life, to feel self-expressed, and enable you to live your life powerfully. 

In addition, as well as self-expression and empowering you as an individual, Wannabe Music believes playing music or singing with others allows you to work together with your community to take on whatever you want in life. You can be a source of inspiration for yourself and for others in your life as well as living your personal dreams.

results.description:
WooCommerce has emerged as the most popular method to sell online with close to 600K sites powered by WordPress and WooCommerce and over 6 million downloads. Our success has always been hinged to the amazing WordPress & WooCommerce communities.

We would love to grow our community and integrate like-minded people to talk and help each other out with everything Woo-related. Are you an avid WooCommerce enthusiast and wanting to be a part of a community of passionate developers, store owners and ecommerce specialists? We’d love you to get involved in organising our WooCommerce meetups all over the globe.

Meetups are meant to benefit the local WooCommerce community through live events and the broader WordPress community through the sharing of knowledge.

In the past year we’ve crept more and more out of our cyber shell and attended an increasing amount of WordPress events and ecommerce events. The response to all things WooCommerce has been tremendous but the need users have for collaboration and assistance is abundant. We recognize that their are limitations to what we can do for our users on WooThemes.com and thus want to create space for users (developers and store owners) to connect, help one another and see what emerges. Simply put, amazing things happen when people come together.
results.name: New York WooCommerce Meetup

topics.name: Exploring The World - Traveling and Excursions

results.description:
So with 8.4+ million people in NYC, I find it very difficult to believe that I am the only Christian teacher who happens LOVE traveling. I don't want to sound selfish or spoiled but I travel whenever I have off from work. As a teacher, my schedule for time off is built into the year (I have no control of when I have time off and I know my schedule a year in a advance). I love teaching as I know it's a job I was called to do. I've been an Early Childhood Special Education teacher for the past 6 years. I love teaching AND traveling but unfortunately, get to do the majority of it alone. Sometimes, for certain excursions or activities, it's better to go with someone. I tend to have more fun being around people. The perk of traveling alone is that you get to meet so many cool people from around the world but I wondered if there were others like me that I can travel with? I don't smoke, drink or curse and during my travels I have come to realize that I stand out, just by not doing any of the above. I get asked about it and explain that I simply have no reason to do so (I could explain Romans 12:2, but I'm not sure they'll understand.) Some respect it and many do not. So maybe there are teachers like me out there (WHERE ARE YOU?), who have the time, interest and money to travel and want to do it with like-minded individuals! Let's travel together and not be conformed to this world BUT see the beautiful world God has created!!! There's so much out there to see and I've only touched 9% of the countries in this world. I have a lot more traveling to do!! http://www.travbuddy.com/maps/6880222

Will you Join?
results.name: Christian Traveling Educators

results.description: I started this group to hopefully help others like myself who are shy (at first) and introverted (or reclusive) come out and meet new people in an non-intimidating atmosphere. I know what it's like to go to a meetup and feel so overwhelmed or feel as if I don't "fit in". There's an inner "adventurous extrovert" in me somewhere and I hope to meet others who feel the same way! Some of the activities in this group will require stepping outside comfort zones and challenging your self. The goals for this group are to bring people together, challenge ourselves, have fun and form new friendships! Members are also HIGHLY encouraged to recommend ideas and set up meetups. Some of the meetups will include dancing, amusement parks, day/weekend trips to other cities (Phila, Boston, Atlantic City,), ice skating, rollerskating, fitness (yoga, bootcamps), etc, acting improv classes, movies and dinner, day parties (monthly bday celebrations), games, expos, etc. Most of the meetups will have a cap limit. results.description:
The Temple Isaiah Young Professionals Group consists of young, Jewish young professionals (in our 20s, 30s and 40s) located in or the around Great Neck, NY area. Thegroup is affiliated with Temple of Isaiah of Great Neck, a reform congregation off of Cutter Mill Road in Great Neck. Temple Isaiah is a warm, welcoming, non-judgmental community of friends that welcomes all who seek a Jewish experience. 

The goal of our group is to foster an interactive community of young, Jewish professionals who wish to participate in a variety of activities at three levels: 1) primarily, social activities; 2) social action activities (in a way to give back to the local and even broader community); and 3) Jewish learning events (including a variety of classes, films and outings). 

For additional information feel free to send your inquiries to: templeisaiahyoungprofessionals@gmail.com or feel free to leave a message any time on our Meetup site. 

We hope to talk to you and see you soon!

results.description:
My Name is Kenti and I'm starting a band and helping other people follow their dream of starting a band.

This is a group for Musicians who want to start or join a band.  The goal is to have people support each other in all aspects of getting started with a few bands, and making them successful: Finding the right band members, building our chops, managing rehearsals, concert performances, recordings, marketing, learning the music business and getting paid for our work.

This is not going to be your ordinary meetup group.  The ordinary meetup group is one where you go to gatherings week after week, or month after month, and nothing happens.  Your skills don't improve and the group doesn't seem to be going anywhere.  You may hook up with a few people here and there but nothing ever comes of it.  Or maybe you have a band that does one or two performances somewhere, then it fizzles. You've been down that road.  You know exactly where it ends.  I have designed this meetup group to be different.  The goal is for us to be successful at establishing a few bands within a short period of time, then follow through and make every band we've established a critical and commercial success.  If you're up to participating and taking your best shot at making something happen, I Invite you to join this group.

I am an experienced Guitarist (Jazz, Blues, Rock, Folk, Reggae), Composer, Recording Engineer, and Business Manager.  I've been in bands, and currently perform solo gigs around New York and New Jersey and I've taught guitar and piano for over 16 years. For practice, I often perform in the NYC Subway; I use those performances to invent and develop new musical ideas in front of the commuting audience.  This has already contributed to the recording of CD collection of my original music.

Your age is not important.  We will have bands with young musicians, bands with older musicians, bands with young and old mixed, and everything in between.
results.name: Starting a Great Band
